book_level.description: Upper elementary level - humorous contemporary fiction about wealth, friendship, and family values

questions.question: What is the main character's full name?

options.A: Bob Spud
options.B: Tom Spud
options.C: Raj Spud
options.D: Joe Spud

questions.explanation: The main character is Joe Spud, a 12-year-old billionaire boy.

questions.question: How old is Joe at the start of the story?

options.A: 11 years old
options.B: 12 years old
options.C: 13 years old
options.D: 10 years old

questions.explanation: The text says 'He was only 12, but he was ridiculously, preposterously rich.'

questions.question: What product made Joe's dad a billionaire?

options.A: Cleanwipe tissues
options.B: Softroll toilet paper
options.C: Wetwipe baby wipes
options.D: Bumfresh moist tissue

questions.explanation: Mr Spud invented Bumfresh, a moist toilet tissue roll that made the family billionaires.

questions.question: What is Joe's best friend's name?

options.A: Raj the shopkeeper
options.B: Alan the Cub Scout leader
options.C: Bob the fat boy
options.D: Dave from school

questions.explanation: Bob is the fat boy who becomes Joe's best friend at his new school.

questions.question: What job did Mr Spud have before becoming rich?

options.A: He rolled toilet paper at a factory
options.B: He sold newspapers at a shop
options.C: He drove a delivery truck
options.D: He taught at a local school

questions.explanation: Mr Spud had to roll the paper around the cardboard inner tube at a loo roll factory.

questions.question: What is the name of Joe's previous posh school?

options.A: St. Peter's Boarding School
options.B: Westminster Academy for Boys
options.C: St. Cuthbert's School for Boys
options.D: Royal Boys School London

questions.explanation: Joe attended St. Cuthbert's School for Boys which cost £200,000 a term.

questions.question: Who runs the local newsagent shop?

options.A: Mrs Trafe the dinner lady
options.B: Raj the friendly shopkeeper
options.C: Mr Spud runs it as a hobby
options.D: Bob's mum after work

questions.explanation: Raj runs the local newsagent shop where the boys go to buy chocolate.

questions.question: What are the names of the twin bullies?

options.A: Tom and Jerry Smith
options.B: Jim and Jane Wilson
options.C: Dave and Sue Grub
options.D: Pete and Kate Brown

questions.explanation: The Grubs are twin bullies named Dave and Sue Grub.

questions.question: What did Joe crash at the beginning of the story?

options.A: A fancy golf buggy
options.B: A brand new bicycle
options.C: A fast speedboat
options.D: A Formula One racing car

questions.explanation: Joe crashes his Formula One car while trying to eat a Mars bar and drive at the same time.

questions.question: How much pocket money does Joe get per week?

options.A: One million pounds
options.B: One hundred thousand pounds
options.C: One thousand pounds
options.D: Ten thousand pounds

questions.explanation: The text lists £100,000 a week pocket money among Joe's possessions.

questions.question: What is the dinner lady's name?

options.A: Mrs Trafe the cook
options.B: Mrs Spite the witch
options.C: Mrs Grub the bully
options.D: Mrs Cook the chef

questions.explanation: Mrs Trafe is the dinner lady whose cooking is described as truly revolting.

questions.question: What did Mr Spud put on his bald head?

options.A: Nothing, he liked being bald
options.B: A designer baseball cap
options.C: An expensive toupee collection
options.D: A fancy top hat

questions.explanation: Mr Spud bought toupees for £10,000 each, including blonde, brown, ginger and afro options.

questions.question: What is the Spuds' enormous house called?

options.A: Bumfresh Towers
options.B: Billionaire Palace
options.C: Spud Manor Estate
options.D: Rich House Tower

questions.explanation: Mr Spud named their house Bumfresh Towers after his famous product.

questions.question: What chocolate bar does Joe buy for Bob?

options.A: A large Mars bar
options.B: A huge Kit Kat bar
options.C: A big Snickers bar
options.D: A giant Dairy Milk bar

questions.explanation: Bob chooses a giant bar of Cadbury's Dairy Milk which costs £3.20.

questions.question: What happened to Bob's dad?

options.A: He got a new job far away
options.B: He went to work abroad
options.C: He moved to another country
options.D: He died of cancer last year

questions.explanation: Bob tells Joe 'My dad died last year' from cancer.

questions.question: What nickname do students call Miss Spite?

options.A: The Monster
options.B: The Dragon Lady
options.C: The Beast
options.D: The Witch

questions.explanation: Miss Spite is called 'the Witch' by the students.

questions.question: How much did Mr Spud give Joe for his 12th birthday?

options.A: Five hundred thousand pounds
options.B: Two million pounds
options.C: One hundred thousand pounds
options.D: One million pounds

questions.explanation: Mr Spud initially gave one million but increased it to two million when Joe complained.

questions.question: Where did Bob's parents first meet each other?

options.A: At their local school together
options.B: At the Tesco supermarket
options.C: At the church on Sunday
options.D: At a birthday party nearby

questions.explanation: Bob's mum works at Tesco, on the checkout. That's where she met his dad.

questions.question: What unusual animal did the Spuds have as a butler?

options.A: A gorilla named George
options.B: A monkey named Max
options.C: An orangutan named Otis
options.D: A chimpanzee named Charlie

questions.explanation: They even had a butler called Otis who was also an orangutan.

questions.question: What does Joe really want for his birthday?

options.A: A brand new sports car
options.B: Even more spending money
options.C: A bigger mansion house
options.D: A friend to hang out with

questions.explanation: When asked what he wants, Joe says 'A friend.'

questions.question: According to the story, Joe was quite fat because ---.

options.A: he ate too much fast food daily
options.B: he never did any exercise at all
options.C: he could buy all the chocolate he wanted
options.D: he had a medical condition problem

questions.explanation: The text states 'He was quite fat. Well, you would be, wouldn't you, if you could buy all the chocolate in the world.'

questions.question: At St Cuthbert's School, the posh kids bullied Joe because ---.

options.A: he couldn't play sports with them well
options.B: his dad's toilet paper business was vulgar
options.C: he was not from an old wealthy family
options.D: he wasn't smart enough for the school

questions.explanation: The posh kids called Joe names like 'Bum-Boy' because his dad made money from loo rolls, which they said was awfully vulgar.

questions.question: Joe didn't arrive at his new school in a Rolls-Royce because ---.

options.A: the expensive car was being repaired
options.B: he didn't want kids to know he was rich
options.C: his dad wouldn't let him take the car
options.D: he wanted to walk there for exercise

questions.explanation: He didn't want to arrive by Rolls-Royce because that would be a pretty good hint to the other kids that he was rich.

questions.question: During cross-country running, Joe paid Bob fifty pounds because ---.

options.A: Bob needed money for his lunch that day
options.B: Bob had won the race against everyone
options.C: Joe felt very sorry for poor Bob
options.D: Joe wanted Bob to come last instead of him

questions.explanation: Joe had a stitch and didn't want to be last, so he paid Bob fifty pounds to come last.

questions.question: Mr Spud invented Bumfresh while working at the factory because ---.

options.A: his factory boss asked him to invent it
options.B: another factory worker gave him the idea
options.C: he had lots of time to daydream at work
options.D: he studied chemistry and science at night

questions.explanation: The only good thing about working in a factory was that Mr Spud had lots of time to daydream. One day, he had a daydream that was to revolutionize bottom wiping forever.

questions.question: When Joe's parents split up, his mother Carol left because ---.

options.A: she wanted to travel the world alone
options.B: she was unhappy with all the money
options.C: Mr Spud was too busy working all day
options.D: she had an affair with Joe's Cub Scout leader

questions.explanation: Carol had been having a torrid affair with Joe's Cub Scout leader, Alan.

questions.question: Raj recognized Joe from a magazine because ---.

options.A: Joe was famous at his previous school
options.B: Joe's photo was in the Sunday Times rich list
options.C: Joe had been on television many times
options.D: Raj knew Mr Spud from the old days

questions.explanation: Raj found the Sunday Times rich list showing 'Britain's richest children, number one, Joe Spud.'

questions.question: The Grubs threw Bob into a wheelie bin because ---.

options.A: it was a mean school tradition here
options.B: Bob owed them money from before
options.C: Bob had insulted them in the hall
options.D: they wanted to steal his chocolate bar

questions.explanation: The Grubs demanded 'Give us your chocolate' and after taking it, they deposited him into the wheelie bin.

questions.question: Bob didn't tell anyone about the bullying because ---.

options.A: the teachers already knew what happened
options.B: he didn't know who to tell about it
options.C: the Grubs threatened to really beat him up
options.D: he thought the bullying was funny actually

questions.explanation: Bob said 'The Grubs said if I ever told anyone that they would really beat me up.'

questions.question: When Bob found out Joe was a billionaire, he gave back the fifty pounds because ---.

options.A: he was very angry at Joe for lying
options.B: he just liked hanging out with Joe as friends
options.C: Joe asked for the money back from him
options.D: he felt too guilty about taking it from Joe

questions.explanation: Bob said 'I don't want your money... I just liked hanging out with you today.'

questions.question: No one ate in the school canteen because ---.

options.A: the Grubs controlled the whole canteen
options.B: the food was way too expensive for kids
options.C: Mrs Trafe's cooking was truly revolting
options.D: the canteen was always closed at lunch

questions.explanation: The text says 'The kids in the school would rather die than eat anything she cooked.'

questions.question: Mr Spud made birthday presents from loo roll tubes because ---.

options.A: Joe always asked for homemade gifts
options.B: it was their family tradition always
options.C: Joe loved craft projects so much
options.D: the family was so poor back then

questions.explanation: Because the family was so poor, Mr Spud used to make birthday and Christmas presents for his son from the loo roll inner tubes.

questions.question: Joe wanted to attend a normal school because ---.

options.A: his dad couldn't afford St Cuthbert's fees
options.B: the posh school was too far away now
options.C: he really hated learning at posh schools
options.D: he hoped to make friends like normal kids

questions.explanation: Joe says 'I want to go to a normal school with normal kids. I want to make a friend, Dad.'

questions.question: The Spuds' house was so large that ---.

options.A: they needed helicopters to travel inside it
options.B: Joe often got lost walking around inside
options.C: it required one hundred servants to run
options.D: it took five minutes to drive up the driveway

questions.explanation: The text says 'It took five minutes just to motor up the drive.'

questions.question: Joe couldn't get on the bus because ---.

options.A: he didn't know which bus to take home
options.B: the driver wouldn't accept his £50 note
options.C: there wasn't enough room for him inside
options.D: he missed the bus by just one minute

questions.explanation: Joe hadn't realised that a £50 note was not going to be welcome to pay for a £2 bus fare.

questions.question: Bob's mum works two jobs as a Tesco worker and ---.

options.A: a nurse at the hospital at night
options.B: a cook at a restaurant downtown
options.C: a teacher at the local primary school
options.D: a cleaner at an old people's home

questions.explanation: Bob says 'She's got another job too. She's a cleaner at an old people's home in the evenings.'

questions.question: When Miss Spite found out Joe forgot his homework, she gave him ---.

options.A: extra homework as his punishment
options.B: a failing grade on his assignment
options.C: fifteen minutes to get his essay
options.D: detention for the whole week ahead

questions.explanation: Miss Spite says 'I will give you 15 minutes exactly to place said essay in my hand.'

questions.question: At cross-country running, Bob appeared in his vest and Y-fronts because ---.

options.A: his friends dared him to do it
options.B: he forgot his kit at home that day
options.C: someone had hidden his running kit
options.D: he was trying to be funny for laughs

questions.explanation: When Mr Bruce asked about his kit, Bob answered 'Someone must have hidden it, sir.'

questions.question: The kids at school chanted 'Blob' at Bob because ---.

options.A: it was a nickname mocking his weight
options.B: he said he liked the name Blob
options.C: it was his real name from birth
options.D: the teachers started using it first

questions.explanation: The kids cruelly chanted 'Blob, blob, blob' as Bob finished last in cross-country, mocking him.

questions.question: According to the Sunday Times rich list, Joe's worth was ---.

options.A: ten billion pounds total
options.B: one billion pounds total
options.C: five billion pounds total
options.D: one hundred billion total

questions.explanation: The magazine listed 'Joe Spud, age twelve, Bumfresh heir, estimated worth ten billion.'

questions.question: Joe's list of possessions shows that material wealth ---.

options.A: always makes people truly happy inside
options.B: doesn't guarantee friendship or happiness
options.C: makes rich people better than others
options.D: is what everyone should want in life

questions.explanation: Despite having everything money can buy, Joe has no friends and is lonely, showing material wealth doesn't equal happiness.

questions.question: Joe and Bob both finishing last in cross-country is significant because ---.

options.A: it starts a friendship based on shared struggle
options.B: it proves they are both bad at sports
options.C: it means they should quit the school team
options.D: it shows the PE teacher was very unfair

questions.explanation: The shared experience of struggling together creates the foundation for their friendship based on understanding rather than wealth.

questions.question: The contrast between St Cuthbert's and the comprehensive school shows ---.

options.A: that public schools are always better overall
options.B: that posh schools are always bad for children
options.C: that posh schools always give better education
options.D: the difference between snobbery and real connection

questions.explanation: At St Cuthbert's, Joe was bullied for being 'new money,' but at the comprehensive, he could find genuine friendship.

questions.question: Bob returning the fifty pounds shows that true friendship ---.

options.A: means poor people don't want any money
options.B: requires people to be very proud always
options.C: is impossible between rich and poor kids
options.D: values the person more than their wealth

questions.explanation: Bob's refusal shows he values Joe for who he is, not what he has, demonstrating the story's theme about authentic friendship.

questions.question: Mr Spud eating expensive caviar despite hating it shows that ---.

options.A: caviar is actually delicious when prepared right
options.B: money can make people act against their nature
options.C: he should buy even more expensive foods
options.D: rich people always love expensive food a lot

questions.explanation: Mr Spud admits caviar is 'absolutely disgusting' but says 'we are rich, son. We have to eat all this posh stuff now.'

questions.question: The joke about Bob's dad 'going for milk but leaving with a wife' shows ---.

options.A: that genuine love comes from ordinary moments
options.B: that he was a very funny person overall
options.C: that his dad was very irresponsible always
options.D: that shopping at Tesco is very dangerous

questions.explanation: This contrasts with Mr Spud dating Page Three girls, showing the difference between authentic love and superficial relationships.

questions.question: Mrs Trafe's disgusting menu items like 'hair lasagna' are used to ---.

options.A: create comedy while bonding the two boys
options.B: prove that the school needs more money
options.C: make readers feel sick about lunch food
options.D: show that school food is really that bad

questions.explanation: The ridiculously gross menu uses exaggeration for comic effect while creating another shared experience for Joe and Bob.

questions.question: Joe hiding his wealth at the new school shows he ---.

options.A: wants to be valued for who he really is
options.B: thinks being poor is better than being rich
options.C: wants to trick people for fun and games
options.D: is very ashamed of being rich always

questions.explanation: Joe learned from St Cuthbert's that money affects how people treat him, so he wants to be judged on his personality.

questions.question: Mr Spud's ridiculous toupees looking like 'dead rodents' suggest that ---.

options.A: all toupees look bad on bald people
options.B: he should have bought more expensive ones
options.C: he simply has very poor fashion taste
options.D: money cannot buy authenticity or self-acceptance

questions.explanation: The toupee symbolizes how wealth is used to mask insecurities, but the result is ridiculous rather than convincing.

questions.question: Bob's advice to 'stand up to bullies' is both wise and problematic because ---.

options.A: it means he should fight back violently
options.B: standing up to bullies always works out
options.C: bullies always back down when challenged
options.D: it could get Bob seriously hurt in reality

questions.explanation: The advice is morally sound but practically dangerous for Bob, which is why Joe thinks there might be 'another way.'

questions.question: The attitudes at St Cuthbert's about 'old money' versus 'new money' show ---.

options.A: that there is no real difference between them
options.B: that class prejudice exists even among the wealthy
options.C: that new money is more respectable always
options.D: that old money families are always better

questions.explanation: The posh boys with inherited wealth consider Joe's earned fortune 'vulgar,' showing class snobbery among the rich.

questions.question: The orangutan butler Otis being 'given the sack' shows that ---.

options.A: orangutans actually make excellent butlers
options.B: the Spuds truly love animals very much
options.C: they simply needed more household staff
options.D: extreme wealth leads to absurd impractical choices

questions.explanation: Having an orangutan butler is an example of ridiculous extravagance that was impractical.

questions.question: Joe keeping the 'sad loo roll space rocket' his dad made shows ---.

options.A: a connection to when love meant more than money
options.B: that he collects all space-related things
options.C: that he just forgot to throw it away
options.D: that the toy is worth money now

questions.explanation: The homemade gift represents the authentic parent-child bond from before wealth, contrasting with the £2 million birthday check.

questions.question: Miss Spite's love of teacher catchphrases shows that ---.

options.A: she enjoys power and control over students
options.B: she is just following school rules strictly
options.C: she is actually a very good teacher
options.D: all teachers use these catchphrases daily

questions.explanation: Miss Spite uses catchphrases with 'evil relish' and is 'desperate for someone to have failed,' showing she enjoys punishing students.

questions.question: Making the Grub twins indistinguishable despite being different genders ---.

options.A: creates comedy while dehumanizing the bullies
options.B: is a mistake that the author made
options.C: doesn't really mean anything important
options.D: shows that all twins are exactly identical

questions.explanation: The joke that Dave and Sue are indistinguishable uses absurdity to dehumanize the bullies while creating humor.

questions.question: Joe's guilt about paying Bob to come last shows ---.

options.A: that Joe wants to control Bob completely
options.B: that he regrets wasting his money
options.C: that Joe is very manipulative always
options.D: that he's learning friendship isn't about money

questions.explanation: Joe feels guilty about using money to solve problems and wants to help Bob genuinely.

questions.question: Mr Spud dating young Page Three models suggests that ---.

options.A: age differences don't matter in relationships
options.B: wealth attracts superficial relationships from both sides
options.C: he should date older women instead
options.D: all Page Three models are the same

questions.explanation: The 27-year age gap and Sapphire's description suggests wealth attracts relationships based on status rather than genuine connection.

questions.question: Joe wondering how to 'fit in with normal kids' shows that ---.

options.A: wealth can isolate people from normal experiences
options.B: public schools are always very scary
options.C: rich kids can never make real friends
options.D: Joe thinks he is better than other kids

questions.explanation: This shows how extreme wealth creates isolation and makes normal social interactions feel unfamiliar.

questions.question: Joe asking for a 'friend' as his birthday present reveals that ---.

options.A: he is very greedy and wants even more
options.B: friends can easily be bought with money
options.C: he doesn't really know what he wants
options.D: money cannot buy genuine human connection

questions.explanation: Despite having unlimited money, Joe cannot purchase the thing he most wants, highlighting the story's central theme.

questions.question: The overall message of Billionaire Boy is that ---.

options.A: poor people are always happier than rich
options.B: everyone should give away all their money
options.C: money can't replace genuine relationships and identity
options.D: being rich is always terrible for people

questions.explanation: The story shows that while poverty has hardships, wealth without authentic relationships leads to loneliness.
